Start: ^Welcome to Dragoman: The English in the Ottoman World
^<u>Dragoman</u> is the term for the professional translators and interpreters from the Ottoman Empire era.
^It was these important intermediaries who facilitated communication across cultural and linguistic boundaries.
^Dragomans were essential for 17th- and 18th-century English travelers and diplomats in the Ottoman world as they navigated the Ottoman realm.
^This game takes this name as it focuses on five vignettes based on five primary sources which relate to the English in the Ottoman World.
^Each of these stories in some form examine cross culture communication - often made possible by a dragoman hardly mentioned in the primary sources themselves.
^Four of these stories (Ch. 1,3,4,and 5) are inspired by on historical material found at Yale University's Lewis Walpole Library.
^This game was produced by students in two courses in Fall 2025 at Central Connecticut State University...

^GMST 100: Intro to Game Studies - for the game development portion of the project
HIST 402:The Ottomans: Rise of an Empire - for the historical research related to the project.
^Each story is independent and can be played separately.
